Hebrew put him forth as their religious chief.
I should say no other conclusion can be drawn
from their act but that they did do so.

KKBenai Israel has no clique, has no jealous
feelings, “judge not lest ye be judged” KKB Israel
has a reader who for 18 years have sewed them they
will not dismiss him even with the progress of the
age, how many ministers have Benai Jeshurun
had? Who is the clique that first engages and then
rejects? or are they so constituted that the minis
ter can not remain with them, all these questions
become pertinent when the representatives of one
Congn because members of another write certain
matters attack the Congn of which those gentlemen
writers are members. Have the KKB Israel ever
missed in these disputes? if not why attack her or
attempt to bring her into controversy, all such attemps
are futile, and will be, she rests too well on her
duties without engendering or aiding quarrels, why
is her clerical head traduced by inuendo or by direct
charge. Amongst the multitudinous
and multifarious matters in that delectable ema
nation in your April number it is said that “the Par
-nas knowing Mr Malzer to be the dictator of the Congn “&c
that which sentence conveys two erroneous charges first that the Par
nas knew a fact and second that that fact exis=
ted, as it is not true that Mr Malzer is or ever was
the dictator of the congn both those statements are
unfounded, and how knew those gentlemen what Malzer
fears, or his motives were, Oh charitable men, to
ascribe baseness where the Immaculate along can
judge. The writer or rather the signer
of the paper to which I have already referred
appear to have had the idea that they will kill three
birds with one stone first annihalate Malzer and

Myer, next disparage KKB Jeshurun Israel and thirdly
to lavish on themselves (their congn) all praise
modest gentlemen, wise gentlemen and just gentlemen.

Wherefore seek to widen a breach if any
does exist between the KKBI & the KKBJ do
not all the attributes of religion and of the Diety
teach, a contrary course. I claim again that
so far as our Congregation as a whole is concer
ned there is no “jealous feeling manifested” on the
contrary we have endeavoured to harmonise, to
united in the progress of Judaism, we have endea
voured to have a common burial ground, we were
met with a declination, we desired to have a United School for the two Congns and in reply we
were met by the passage of the following resolutions
by the whole Congregation of KKB Jeshurun in
March 1850 “Whereas we have Read a communica
“tion from our sister congregation KKBna Israel
“in which they show their unanimous favor in
“this projected Union Whereas at the present
“the Congregation KKBeni Jeshurun have established
“the Talmud Yalodim School which is in a most
“prosperous condition and whereas This congrega
“=tion fearing from what has heretofore passed be
“=tween them different congregations can see at
“present no advantage by uniting with Congn
“B Israel” Here is their spirit and still
they as representatives of KKB Jeshurun charge
KKB. Israel with manifesting adverse and jea
lous feelings. I could Sir increase
proofs and arguments I desist because I do not
desire to mix myself up in this cauldron my
chief aim has been to deny, what by implica
tion I have been charged with that is mixing in
this matter heretofore. I have cautiously
abstained from commenting at all on Revd

Mr Rosenfelt, the charges brought against him, or
the theological discussion, I have also endea-
voured in the explanation I have seen fit to make
to abstain from offence to any individual or to
the KKBI if I have done either it is without
intent. In conclusion I am
